Title: Norwegian planned maintenance dents pipeline gas supply to Europe
Description: Planned maintenance at several Norwegian gas fields today has removed a significant chunk of natural gas supply from the market, with yesterday’s Title Transfer Facility (TTF) price surging.
Author: JS

Title: Mercuria to supply LNG to Guangzhou Gas on a long-term basis
Description: Energy trader Mercuria said that its trading arm has signed a long-term sales and purchase agreement with China’s Guangzhou Gas, but it did not disclose the volume, start of supplies, or term of the deal.
Author: JS

Title: EU sanctions three Russian “dark” fleet LNG tankers in 17th sanction package
Description: The Council of the EU has released its 17th sanctions package targeting Russia for its ongoing invasion of Ukraine, under which it sanctioned three more LNG tankers believed to be part of the “dark” fleet of tankers.
Author: JS

Title: MSC Cruises adds two LNG-fuelled ships to World Class fleet
Description: Switzerland-headquartered MSC Cruises has ordered two additional LNG-fuelled cruise ships from French shipbuilder Chantiers de l’Atlantique, expanding its World Class series of ships to six  by 2030. The newly ordered ships, referred to as World Class 5 and 6, will be delivered in 2029 and 2030, subject to financing.
Author: CK

Title: Mukran LNG terminal to halt gas transmission from June 2–3 for pipeline maintenance
Description: LNG terminal operator Deutsche ReGas will temporarily suspend gas transmission from its Deutsche Ostsee LNG terminal in Mukran on June 2–3 due to scheduled pipeline maintenance by gas transmission system operator Gascade.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron shuts Leviathan gas platform for turnaround until June 3
Description: Chevron has begun a scheduled maintenance shutdown of its Leviathan gas platform offshore Israel, with the turnaround expected to last until June 3. The temporary halt affects a key gas source in the Eastern Mediterranean, including exports to Egypt amid surging demand and weak domestic output there.
Author: CK

Title: QatarEnergy targets end-2025 start for Golden Pass LNG, mid-2026 for North Field East
Description: QatarEnergy expects to boost global LNG supplies through new production coming online from the United States and Qatar over the next year, with initial output from the Golden Pass LNG project in Texas targeted for the end of 2025, and first production from the North Field East expansion in Qatar expected by mid-2026.
Author: CK
